docs.text: Liberty Container Deployment on OpenShift (Day 1) Plus: 1/2 day to get hands-on with IBM WebSphere Automation (Day 2) Thursday, July 17 & 18, 2024 Day 1: Time: 9:00 am - 5:00 pm Day 2: Time: 9:00 am - 12:00 pm This is a 1.5 days technical workshop. Refer to the "Day 1 labs" menu items from the left-navigation section to access Liberty lab guides and lab environment. Refer to the "Day 2 labs" menu items from the left-navigation section to access WebSphere Auomation lab guides and lab environment. Day 1 Proposed Agenda (Liberty container deployments on OCP) Presentation Material Material shared with attendees Hands-on Labs Day 1: Liberty Container Deployment Labs

docs.text: Liberty Container Deployment with OpenShift Access the lab environment >> Click here to access your assigned lab environment for the POT labs: The lab instructor will provide you an `Attendee ID` to use to access the URL to your unique lab environment. Modernization Tools (TA) labs: LAB 2153: Explore IBM Transformation Advisor OR LAB 2154: Enterprise modernization with Transfromation Advisor "common code discovery" Containers and OpenShift labs: LAB 2158: Getting started with containerization LAB 2159: Introduction to container orchestration with OpenShift Modernizing Java apps to Liberty on OpenShift labs: LAB 2161-1: Rapidly deploy and configure Java applications with WebSphere Liberty & OpenShift Container Platform

docs.text: WebSphere Automation Access the WebSphere Automation lab environment >> Click here to access your assigned lab environment for the POT labs: The lab instructor will provide you an `Attendee ID` to use to access the URL to your unique lab environment. WebSphere Automation Lab: LAB 4310: WebSphere Automation WebSphere proactive CVE protection Memory leak detection and automated analysis with WSA and Instana
docs.title: Day 2-WebSphere Automation

docs.text: >> Click here to access your assigned lab environment for the POT labs:
docs.title: Access the WebSphere Automation lab environment

docs.text: LAB 4310: WebSphere Automation WebSphere proactive CVE protection Memory leak detection and automated analysis with WSA and Instana
docs.title: WebSphere Automation Lab:

docs.text: Accessing lab environment Go to the Attendee Lab URL from the Workshop Labs menu item, From the Workshop Labs menu item, select the Lab Environment URL for the specific lab(s) you want to run NOTE: Your workshop password is NOT the password illustrated in the example below. NOTE: Refer to the Workshop Labs page for your specific workshop password. Enter the workshop password: and click the Submit password button Click the Published Services URL to your environment. Note: The Published Service provides direct access to the VM environment that is used for all of the labs in the workshop. Select vnc.html from the directory listing page. Click Connect on the noVNC connection page Enter the noVNC password as passw0rd (That is a numeric zero in passw0rd) Follow the lab guide for instructions Note: Each lab guide includes the information for acessing the VM, how to login to the VM, login credentials, etc.
docs.title: Lab env
